Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a rounded-tipped nozzle with shoulder-volutes, a plain rounded shoulder and a circular groove surrounding the discus. At the rear is a ring-handle. Between the nozzle volutes is an air-slit. The discus is decorated with Isis holding a patera and sistrum, Anubis holding a palm branch and animal-headed sceptre, and a naked Harpocrates holding a cornucopia, with his finger in his mouth. The lamp stands on a slightly raised base. Covered with a finger-marked brown slip.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Strada Campana (said to be from)
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q968)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2013-2014, 12 Oct-2 Feb, Rome, Chiostro del Bramante, Cleopatra: The Magic of Egypt
